content.text: JavaScript Set Date Methods
Set Date methods let you set date values (years, months, days, hours, minutes, seconds, milliseconds) for a Date Object.
content.html: Set Date methods let you set date values (years, months, days, hours, minutes, seconds, milliseconds) for a Date Object.

content.text: Set Date Methods
Set Date methods are used for setting a part of a date:
content.html: Set Date methods are used for setting a part of a date:

content.code_html:
Method Description
setDate() Set the day as a number (1-31)
setFullYear() Set the year (yyyy)
setHours() Set the hour (0-23)
setMilliseconds() Set the milliseconds (0-999)
setMinutes() Set the minutes (0-59)
setMonth() Set the month (0-11)
setSeconds() Set the seconds (0-59)
setTime() Set the time (milliseconds since January 1, 1970)

content.text: The setFullYear() Method
The setFullYear() method sets the year of a date object. In this example to 2020:
content.html: The setFullYear() method sets the year of a date object. In this example to 2020:

content.code_html:
const d = new Date("January 01, 2025");
d.setFullYear(2020);

content.text: The setFullYear() method can optionally set month and day:
content.html: The setFullYear() method can optionally set month and day:

content.code_html:
const d = new Date("January 01, 2025");
d.setFullYear(2020, 11, 3);

content.text: The setMonth() Method
The setMonth() method sets the month of a date object (0-11):
content.html: The setMonth() method sets the month of a date object (0-11):

content.code_html:
const d = new Date("January 01, 2025");
d.setMonth(11);

content.text: The setDate() Method
The setDate() method sets the day of a date object (1-31):
content.html: The setDate() method sets the day of a date object (1-31):

content.code_html:
const d = new Date("January 01, 2025");
d.setDate(15);

content.text: The setDate() method can also be used to add days to a date:
content.html: The setDate() method can also be used to add days to a date:

content.code_html:
const d = new Date("January 01, 2025");
d.setDate(d.getDate() + 50);

content.text: Note
If adding days shifts the month or year, the changes are handled automatically by the Date object.
content.html: If adding days shifts the month or year, the changes are handled automatically by the Date object.

content.text: The setHours() Method
The setHours() method sets the hours of a date object (0-23):
content.html: The setHours() method sets the hours of a date object (0-23):

content.code_html:
const d = new Date("January 01, 2025");
d.setHours(22);

content.text: The setHours() method can also be used to set minutes and seconds.
content.html: The setHours() method can also be used to set minutes and seconds.

content.code_html:
const d = new Date("January 01, 2025");
d.setHours(22, 10, 20);

content.text: The setMinutes() Method
The setMinutes() method sets the minutes of a date object (0-59):
content.html: The setMinutes() method sets the minutes of a date object (0-59):

content.code_html:
const d = new Date("January 01, 2025");
d.setMinutes(30);

content.text: The setSeconds() Method
The setSeconds() method sets the seconds of a date object (0-59):
content.html: The setSeconds() method sets the seconds of a date object (0-59):

content.code_html:
const d = new Date("January 01, 2025");
d.setSeconds(30);

content.text: Compare Dates
Dates can easily be compared.
content.html: Dates can easily be compared.

content.text: The following example compares today's date with January 14, 2100:
content.html: The following example compares today's date with January 14, 2100:

content.code_html:
let text = "";
const today = new Date();
const someday = new Date();
someday.setFullYear(2100, 0, 14);

if (someday > today) {
  text = "Today is before January 14, 2100.";
} else {
  text = "Today is after January 14, 2100.";
}

content.text: Note
JavaScript counts months from 0 to 11. January is 0. December is 11.
content.html: JavaScript counts months from 0 to 11. January is 0. December is 11.

content.text: Complete JavaScript Date Reference
For a complete Date reference, go to our:
content.html: For a complete Date reference, go to our:

content.text: Complete JavaScript Date Reference .
content.html: Complete JavaScript Date Reference.

content.text: The reference contains descriptions and examples of all Date properties and methods.
content.html: The reference contains descriptions and examples of all Date properties and methods.

content.html: What is expected format of the argument in the setDate() method?
